channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: Ground rules for ex-soldier Ben Roberts-Smith's defamation trial could see laptops stored in safes with lawyers only allowed to use them in designated rooms.
item.title: Strict guidelines could be in place for Roberts-Smith defamation trial

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Elizabeth II's role in 1975 is debatable but Australians should not have to call the Palace before taking political decisions.
item.title: Palace letters show the Queen has no place in Australian politics

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: The big write-downs in the value of oil and gas assets are not a surprise, it will be the oil majors' underlying profits that will reveal the havoc caused by the coronavirus.
item.title: Big oil write-downs are cosmetic, the real story of carnage is yet to be told

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: A staff member at a Woolworths in Bowral, in the Southern Highlands south-west of Sydney, has tested positive for coronavirus. Globally there have been more than 13.1 million confirmed COVID-19 cases and almost 575,000 deaths.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 238 new COVID-19 cases as Crossroads Hotel cluster grows in NSW; Australian death toll stands at 111

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: A major super fund is warning further changes to the retirement system will undermine the $3 trillion industry's plans to underwrite job-creating projects.
item.title: Super fund warns retirement changes could limit investment in jobs-boosting projects

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: An 18-year-old was knocked unconscious by a wave and suffered a head injury, and a 15-year-old suffered a hip injury and back pain.
item.title: Teens caught in dangerous surf taken to hospital amid wild seas

item.description: The women of Wisteria Lane dominated TV for years, and there's still lots to enjoy in Desperate Housewives.
item.title: What's on TV: Thursday, July 23

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Canterbury have offered the Penrith assistant a three-year deal to become head coach following Dean Pay's departure.
item.title: 'Massive asset': Nathan Cleary wants Barrett to stay after building platform for Panthers success

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: Props of the world unite. Your time on the golf links is coming, and we may well look back on the day when fancy-pants backs ruled at the Masters with wonder.
item.title: Bigger is better: How bulked-up Bryson is changing the face of golf

item.description: The hype videos that open America's Got Talent are so energised that they're exhausting.
item.title: What's on TV: Wednesday, July 22

item.dc:creator: Hanna Mills Turbet
item.description: Retailers are ramping up their social distancing and hygiene practices, with Woolworths unveiling a new tool that allows customers to monitor foot traffic at its supermarkets.
item.title: Hate queues? New tool lets shoppers track crowds, book supermarket slot

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: The comedian has warned the public may not be so generous again if the money does not go where donors intended it to.
item.title: Celeste Barber and RFS clash over bill to allow sharing of bushfire donations

item.description: Shaun Micallef presents a deft series about Australia's tangled relationship with alcohol.
item.title: What's on TV: Tuesday, July 21

item.description: Officials are in private talks with employer groups to make face coverings mandatory in all public places including offices amid growing fears of a second wave of COVID-19 infections.
item.title: Next stop, masks in offices: Push for face coverings in all UK public places

item.description: Both MasterChef and Big Brother make final bids for audience approval with Monday night finales.
item.title: What's on TV: Monday, July 20

item.description: Armed police were deployed to the town about 70 kilometres south of the capital Oslo.
item.title: Police arrest a man after three women stabbed in Sarpsborg

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: It takes something special to get Hogan to work these days. In a new film about the actor and his most famous character, he thinks he's found it.
item.title: Paul Hogan on new Dundee film: 'Anything that happens now is a bonus'

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: A group of Melbourne apartment residents are worried by advice that allows people with coronavirus to use communal areas, though experts say the risk is low.
item.title: Apartment residents raise alarm over Victorian advice on communal areas

item.dc:creator: Louise Rugendyke
item.description: This four-part drama about the aftershocks of a building collapse in a small town shows how it is too easy to forget.
item.title: From Aberfan to Grenfell, The Accident asks us to never forget

item.description: The White House under the thumb of Nazi sympathisers? By re-inventing the past, a handful of recent US dramas mirror the disarray of the present.
item.title: When TV looks to the past to reveal the present

item.description: Mary Gearin is a lively and engaging newsreader; critics should back off.
item.title: Green Guide letters: TV and radio audiences have their say

item.dc:creator: Ben Pobjie
item.description: The comedian hasn't touched alcohol for decades, yet his documentary, On The Sauce, is the most personal work he has ever done.
item.title: Drunk History: Shaun Micallef takes a deep dive into our booze culture

item.description: Sixty-three years after the first quiz show aired on Australian TV, the genre's appeal hasn't waned.
item.title: Think you're an avid TV viewer? Try this quick puzzler

item.dc:creator: Ben Pobjie
item.description: Fifty years on, Sesame Street's blue-rinse puppet shows no signs of slowing down.
item.title: Grover wants you to know that he's still a very busy monster

item.description: Departure of Country Fire Authority chairman Greg Smith comes weeks after the organisation's chief executive also stepped aside.
item.title: CFA chairman latest to resign after fire services merger

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: Woman raped at knifepoint by a homeless man grabbed her attacker's knife and stabbed him in the buttock before fleeing, a court has heard.
item.title: Woman told rapist 'it's going to hurt when I stab you' during struggle

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: The royal commission heard 50 per cent of residents in aged care are depressed and getting treatment for mental health is impossible.
item.title: Aged care staff assume everyone old is living with dementia, hearing told

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Whether it's new rules, the Crossroads wake-up call or the $5500 fine handed down to the Golden Sheaf, most pubs across Sydney are on high alert with strict COVID-19 measures in place.
item.title: 'More we could be doing': Slip-ups still evident as Sydney pubs fear second lockdown

item.dc:creator: David King
item.description: Sunday Age editor David King and national science reporter Liam Mannix give a COVID-19 vaccine update.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: hunt for COVID-19 vaccine going 'surprisingly well'

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Sunlight could fetch well over $3 million at the Magic Millions broodmare sale on the Gold Coast, according to Julian Blaxland, the bloodstock agent who bought her as a yearling.
item.title: Studs set to throw millions at Sunlight in broodmare sale

item.description: Her body was found in Lake Piru, near Los Angeles, five days after going missing on a boating trip with her young son.
item.title: 'Glee' star Naya Rivera's death ruled accidental drowning

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: The Museum of Brisbane has brought nine wordsmiths together to explore stories of Brisbane for an exhibition.
item.title: House rules at Nick Earls' Red Hill reno? Don't look up in the shower

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Victorian clubs are grappling with the financial implications of being forced out of the state with millions of dollars of anticipated revenue from playing home games at the MCG and Marvel Stadium no longer heading in their direction.
item.title: Evacuation hits Victorian clubs' bottom line

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: Perth Common Ground, the first facility of its kind in Western Australia, will feature 70 dwellings with wraparound health and support services and a cafe or similar offering on the ground floor.
item.title: Perth CBD block to be transformed into apartment tower for rough sleepers

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The club veteran fronted reporters on Wednesday and was bombarded with questions about Dean Pay, who stepped down as coach after the loss to the Broncos.
item.title: 'Leadership starts at the top': Tolman wants clear decisions from Bulldogs board

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Michael Johnson was killed when the loader he was driving veered off the edge of a slope and fell about 25 metres at the Dervish underground mine.
item.title: 'We are shattered': Tributes flow for young Perth father who died on WA mine site

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: Minister adds that attendance of perpetrators at some courses fell by a quarter when coronavirus forced meetings to be by teleconference.
item.title: 'It's terrifying': Backlog for violent abusers program blows out to 8 months

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: One of the Big Bash League's biggest names has taken aim at Cricket Australia over the length of the upcoming BBL season as CA tables key changes to its rain rules for the summer ahead.
item.title: Lynn takes aim at CA as rain rule changes tabled

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: Fremantle and West Coast's hopes of a successful 2020 AFL season appear on the rise, with the WA clubs set to be based in Perth for the remaining home-and-away season.
item.title: Dockers, Eagles likely to stay in Perth for entire AFL season

item.description: The $116 million regional land booster package will see discounts applied to 376 lots in the Pilbara and a further 719 development-ready industrial, commercial and residential lots across WA.
item.title: Pilbara lot prices slashed in efforts to spark red dirt building boost

item.description: The country has had no community transmission for more than two months, but is ready if the virus returns, the PM says.
item.title: 'We have a plan': Ardern says NZ must prepare for virus resurgence

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: With former husband under police guard in hospital, Elaine Pandilovski - who was found dead in her Mill Park home - has been remembered as a 'beautiful' mother.
item.title: 'Beautiful angel': Estranged husband arrested after woman found dead

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: AFL boss Gillon McLachlan has confirmed all Victorian clubs will relocate to Queensland for about 10 weeks as the league grapples with the COVID-19 crisis.
item.title: 'Keep the game alive': AFL confirms Victorian clubs' move to Queensland

item.dc:creator: Neha Kale
item.description: Kurdish refugee Farhad Bandesh knows a phone call doesn’t just bridge the distance between two people. It can open a door to creative freedom.
item.title: How seven years in detention led Farhad Bandesh to singer Laura Jean

item.description: Listen in as this week's episode delves into what the upcoming US reporting season might offer up and examines what is driving gold and iron ore prices higher.
item.title: The Short Squeeze: Will the rush for gold continue?

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: John Schaeffer was known for buying, selling and collecting some of the most valuable artwork to enter Australia, including a number of pre-Raphaelite pieces.
item.title: Sydney art collector and businessman dies aged 79

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: Former NSW Rural Fire Service Commissioner Shane Fitzsimmons made his first appearance before the bushfire royal commission on its 23rd day of public hearings.
item.title: As it happened: Shane Fitzsimmons speaks at bushfire royal commission about Australia's 'Black Summer'

item.description: After months of uncertainty, the billionaire has managed to snatch his airline from the brink of failure under the weight of the coronavirus crisis.
item.title: Richard Branson retains control of Virgin Atlantic in $2.2b rescue

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Woodside has been granted special permission for its interstate fly-in, fly-out workforce to exclusively self-isolate in Quest Serviced Apartments in Midland.
item.title: Woodside books out Perth hotel for exclusive FIFO workforce quarantine

item.description: A new study shows that almost everyone responds to the right exercise program, but the right exercise program can differ from person to person.
item.title: There's an optimal exercise for everyone. So what's the best for you?
